snippet: Media and Internet giants at odds over dealing with stolen content on the Web may need to agree first on exactly how bad the problem is, Jenna Wortham and Amy Chozick report. Media companies say they are facing a relentless barrage of thefts. Some in...
abstract: Media and Internet giants at odds over dealing with stolen content on the Web may need to agree first on exactly how bad the problem is, Jenna Wortham and Amy Chozick report. Media companies say they are facing a relentless barrage of thefts. Some in the tech world say there is certainly not enough of a crisis to justify measures that might hurt the development of the Internet. Read more »

headline.main: In Piracy Debate, Deciding if the Sky Is Falling
